net.antidot.api.search

Class Connector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.antidot.api.search.Connector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectorInterface

    public class Connector
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConnectorInterface
    Antidot search engine connector.

    This connector is used to interact with Antidot search engine.

    Main method to call is send(Map).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connector

        public Connector(java.lang.String host,
         Service service)
        Constructs connector. Connector is created with default URL scheme AFS_SCHEME_HTTP (see Scheme).
        Parameters:
        host - [in] host name of the server hosting Antidot search service.
        service - [in] service to consider on the hosting server (see Service)

      • Connector

        public Connector(Scheme scheme,
         java.lang.String host,
         Service service)
        Constructs connector with specific URL scheme. This constructor allows to specify alternative scheme.
        Parameters:
        scheme - [in] URL scheme (currently only AFS_SCHEME_HTTP is supported)
        host - [in] host name of the server hosting Antidot search service
        service - [in] service to consider on the hosting server (see Service)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when scheme argument is unsupported.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public byte[] send(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> params)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: ConnectorInterface
        Sends query with specified parameters.
        Specified by:
        send in interface ConnectorInterface
        Parameters:
        params - [in] parameters used to query Antidot search engine.
        Returns:
        byte array containing reply as Google protobuf.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on various conditions.
